document_data.mainbody:
Midnight Star was a variety of wine from the vineyards of AlQuidm, distributed by the Sindarian merchant house of Procampur in the late 14 century DR.
Midnight Star was an overpriced, sweet red table wine of decent quality. It had a striking brilliant red color.
In the , Midnight Star wine was brought to the year-end celebration festival in the town of Mossbridges in the Vast. Trendel P. Butterworth, a representative of Sindarian house, entered the wine into a wine-tasting and grading competition. Butterworths sales pitch claimed that the wine came from a place called "AlQuidm" and was produced out of grapes gathered only during moonless nights by the citys twenty most beautiful women. Because of that, Trendel sold Midnight Star at a single gold coin per bottle or ten per hand keg.
